doc.str: Hydrophilic polymer microparticle, filler for ion exchange liquid chromatography, and method for production of filler for ion exchange liquid chromatography

An object of the present invention is to provide a hydrophilic polymer microparticle which shows reduced swelling in an aqueous medium and has an excellent dispersibility in an aqueous medium, a filler for ion-exchange liquid chromatography which can effectively suppress non-specific adsorption of protein and the like, a method for analyzing glycosylated hemoglobin using the filler for ion-exchange liquid chromatography, a method for production of a filler for ion-exchange liquid chromatography that can maintain suppressive effects on swelling, non-specific adsorption and the like for a long period of time, a filler for ion-exchange liquid chromatography produced by the method for production of a filler for ion-exchange liquid chromatography, and a filler for ion-exchange liquid chromatography for glycosylated hemoglobin analysis.

PTO Translation No. 10-3838 of Japan Patent No. 2000088826. cited by examiner . | PTO Translation No. 97-1373 of Japan Kokai No. 03-118466. cited by examiner . | International Search Report issued Feb. 27, 2007 in the International (PCT) Application of which the present application is the U.S. National Stage. cited by other. | PTO Translation No. 10-3829 of Japan Patent No. 2003207497. cited by examiner . | PTO Translation No. 10-3830 of Japan Patent No. 2006102698. cited by examiner .
